revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/96.238.128.26|96.238.128.26]] ([[User talk:96.238.128.26|talk]]): Don't make these ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{For|disruptive editing on Wikipedia|Disruptive editing}} {{wiktionary|disruption|disruptive}} '''Disruption''' or '''disruptive''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==Business== *[[Creative disruption]], disruption concept in a creative context, introduced in 1992 by TBWAâ€™s chairman Jean-Marie Dru *[[Disruptive innovation]], Clayton Christensen's theory of industry disruption by new technology or products
==Psychology and sociology== *[[Disruptive behavior disorders]], a class of mental health disorders *[[Disruptive physician]], a physician whose obnoxious behaviour upsets patients or other staff *[[Social disruption]], a radical alteration, transformation, dysfunction or breakdown of social life
==Other uses== *[[Cell disruption]] is a method or process in cell biology for releasing biological molecules from inside a cell *[[Disruption (adoption)]] is also the term for the cancellation of an adoption of a child before it is legally completed *[[Disruption (of schema)]], in the field of computer genetic algorithms *[[Disruption of 1843]], the divergence of the Free Church of Scotland from the Church of Scotland *Disruption, a method of disabling an explosive device by using [[projected water disruptors]]
== See also == *[[Disruptor (disambiguation)]]
{{disambiguation}}
